Description: Body sherd of Chian, possibly Simple Animal Style, pottery chalice or Type B kantharos; white slip; interior glazed streaky black; exterior reserved; inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: The size of the sherd, the lack of diagnostic elements and the absence of decoration on the interior and exterior surfaces make it impossible to determine whether it came from a kantharos or a chalice. Chalice Style chalices (including patterned chalices) have little decoration on their interior and exterior. Given the size of the sherd, it may come from an undecorated part of the chalice. Kantharoi Type B (See Williams, D. ‘Aigina, Aphaia-Tempel 5. The pottery from Chios’, Archäologischer Anzeiger 1983, 169) also have very little decoration. The number 89 is written in pencil on the sherd's exterior and is crossed out. The number 9 is also written in pencil on the sherd's exterior and also on a label on the interior of the sherd.
Bibliographic references: Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (pl. 21.1.31)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1484) (phase 2)
